SHO module¶

This SHO.py module generates the matrix form for several common operators in the energy eigenbasis of the harmonic oscillator.

Functions within can generate \(\hat{x}, \hat{p}, \hat{a}^+, \hat{a}, \hat{H}\), and second moments of hat{x} and hat{p}

Example

>>>import SHO >>>SHO.a(3) array([[0. +0.j, 1. +0.j, 0. +0.j],

[0. +0.j, 0. +0.j, 1.41421356+0.j], [0. +0.j, 0. +0.j, 0. +0.j]])

>>>SHO.a_dagger(3) array([[0. +0.j, 0. +0.j, 0. +0.j],

[1. +0.j, 0. +0.j, 0. +0.j], [0. +0.j, 1.41421356+0.j, 0. +0.j]])

The matrices above are used to calculate the energy using the relation \(H = a^+a + 1/2\)

>>>import numpy as np >>>SHO.a_dagger(3)@SHO.a(3) + 0.5 * np.eye(3) array([[0.5+0.j, 0. +0.j, 0. +0.j],

[0. +0.j, 1.5+0.j, 0. +0.j], [0. +0.j, 0. +0.j, 2.5+0.j]])

SHO.H(n=100, w=1, hbar=1, m=1)¶
SHO.SHO_distribution(T, n=50, hbar=1, w=1, k=1)¶
SHO.a(n=100)¶

Make the matrix representation of the lowering operator \(a\)

Parameters:

n (int, optional) – length and width of the resultant square matrix

Returns:

out – matrix of size n by n that represents the lowering operator \(a\)

Return type:

complex ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If n is less than or equal to 1

See also

SHO

overall description of module

a_dagger

raising operator

Notes

The matrix a in the eigenbasis of the Hamiltonian reads

SHO.a_dagger(n=100)¶

Make the matrix representation of the raising operator \(a^+\)

Parameters:

n (int, optional) – length and width of the resultant square matrix

Returns:

out – matrix of size n by n that represents the lowering operator \(a\)

Return type:

complex ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If n is less than or equal to 1

See also

SHO

overall description of harmonic oscillator functions

a

lowering operator

Notes

The matrix \(a^\dagger\) in the eigenbasis of the Hamiltonian reads
